page.title: 02COUNTRY PARK,HORNDEAN
page.content: It has nearly half a million visitors every year. These include 20,000 students from nearby schools and colleges. The aim of the staff is to introduce and interpret the countryside to the general public and to educate them in its conservation. Trails are laid out and guides written to show points of special interest giving relevant information.There is a School Trail,a Butterfly Trail and longer walks of about 2 miles with accompaning booklets giving details of things to be seen and observations to be made. Throughout the year special interest walks are arranged according to the seasons to observe birds,butterflies, insects and animals.Trees and wild _ flowers can also be studied.
